I promise to never stop fighting for #GunViolence prevention measures that make our communities and schools safer. To learn more about this bill, read my full release here: https://casten.house.gov/media/press-releases/casten-introduces-bill-reduce-gun-trafficking
I‚Äôm proud that this bill has gained the support of @Everytown, @NewtownAction, @AMarch4OurLives, @GiffordsCourage, and the @Brady_Campaign.

In 2019, Chicago seized over 10,000 illegally possessed guns; annually, guns illegally trafficked across state lines comprise about 60% of this total. The Gun Trafficker Detection Act is poised to stem this onslaught.
Efforts by states like #Illinois to prevent gun violence are often undermined by traffickers taking advantage of the looser laws in neighboring states like Indiana.
The bill would also make traffickers liable for any damage done by their guns and makes repeat violators ineligible to buy guns for five years.
This requirement would help law enforcement identify & prosecute traffickers, who often claim their gun was lost or stolen when it turns up at a crime scene across state lines.

Today, I introduced the Gun Trafficker Detection Act with @RepRobinKelly and @RepTedDeutch, which would create a federal requirement that gun owners must report their gun if lost or stolen within 48 hours.
When I ran for Congress, I vowed to take legislative action to combat this epidemic: like voting to pass universal background checks and supporting an assault weapons ban.
The anniversaries of these two tragedies make it absolutely clear that we have a #GunViolence problem in this country, where mass shootings happen far too often.

1 year ago Saturday, 5 people lost their lives & many more were injured when a gunman entered an Aurora, Illinois workplace & began shooting. 2 years ago Friday, a former student entered a #Parkland FL high school & killed 17 innocent students, critically injuring just as many.
